name: Ofloxacin

indications.text: ofloxacin otic solution , 0.3 % indicated treatment infections caused susceptible isolates designated microorganisms conditions listed : otitis externain adults pediatric patients , 6 months older , due escherichia coli , pseudomonas aeruginosaand staphylococcus aureus . chronic suppurative otitis mediain patients 12 years older perforated tympanic membranes due proteus mirabilis , pseudomonas aeruginosaand staphylococcus aureus . acute otitis mediain pediatric patients one year older tympanostomy tubes due haemophilus influenzae , moraxella catarrhalis , pseudomonas aeruginosa , staphylococcus aureusand streptococcus pneumoniae .

contraindications.text: otitis externa : recommended regimen treatment otitis externa : pediatric patients ( 6 months 13 years old ) : five drops ( 0.25 ml , 0.75 mg ofloxacin ) instilled affected ear daily seven days . patients 13 years older : ten drops ( 0.5 ml , 1.5 mg ofloxacin ) instilled affected ear daily seven days . solution warmed holding bottle hand one two minutes avoid dizziness may result instillation cold solution . patient lie affected ear upward , drops instilled . position maintained five minutes facilitate penetration drops ear canal . repeat , necessary , opposite ear . acute otitis media pediatric patients tympanostomy tubes : recommended regimen treatment acute otitis media pediatric patients ( 1 12 years old ) tympanostomy tubes : five drops ( 0.25 ml , 0.75 mg ofloxacin ) instilled affected ear twice daily ten days . solution warmed holding bottle hand one two minutes avoid dizziness may result instillation cold solution . patient lie affected ear upward , drops instilled . tragus pumped 4 times pushing inward facilitate penetration drops middle ear . position maintained five minutes . repeat , necessary , opposite ear . chronic suppurative otitis media perforated tympanic membranes : recommended regimen treatment chronic suppurative otitis media perforated tympanic membranes patients 12 years older : ten drops ( 0.5 ml , 1.5 mg ofloxacin ) instilled affected ear twice daily fourteen days . solution warmed holding bottle hand one two minutes avoid dizziness may result instillation cold solution . patient lie affected ear upward , instilling drops . tragus pumped 4 times pushing inward facilitate penetration middle ear . position maintained five minutes . repeat , necessary , opposite ear .

warningsAndPrecautions: ofloxacin otic solution , 0.3 % supplied plastic dropper bottles following sizes : ndc 24208-410-05 5 ml ndc 24208-410-10 10 ml
adverseReactions: ofloxacin otic solution , 0.3 % contraindicated patients history hypersensitivity ofloxacin , quinolones , components medication .
indications_original:
Ofloxacin otic solution, 0.3% is indicated for the treatment of infections caused by susceptible isolates of the designated microorganisms in the specific conditions listed below:
                  
                     Otitis Externain adults and pediatric patients, 6 months and older, due to
 
  Escherichia coli,
 
  Pseudomonas aeruginosaand
 
  Staphylococcus aureus. 
  
                     Chronic Suppurative Otitis Mediain patients 12 years and older with perforated tympanic membranes due to
 
  Proteus mirabilis,
 
  Pseudomonas aeruginosaand
 
  Staphylococcus aureus. 
  
                     Acute Otitis Mediain pediatric patients one year and older with tympanostomy tubes due to
 
  Haemophilus influenzae,
 
  Moraxella catarrhalis,
 
  Pseudomonas aeruginosa,
 
  Staphylococcus aureusand
 
  Streptococcus pneumoniae.
contraindications_original:
Otitis Externa:The recommended dosage regimen for the treatment of otitis externa is:

 
                  For pediatric patients (from 6 months to 13 years old): Five drops (0.25 mL, 0.75 mg ofloxacin) instilled into the affected ear once daily for seven days.
                  For patients 13 years and older: Ten drops (0.5 mL, 1.5 mg ofloxacin) instilled into the affected ear once daily for seven days.
                  The solution should be warmed by holding the bottle in the hand for one or two minutes to avoid dizziness which may result from the instillation of a cold solution. The patient should lie with the affected ear upward, and then the drops should be instilled. This position should be maintained for five minutes to facilitate penetration of the drops into the ear canal. Repeat, if necessary, for the opposite ear.
                  
                     Acute Otitis Media in pediatric patients with tympanostomy tubes:The recommended dosage regimen for the treatment of acute otitis media in pediatric patients (from 1 to 12 years old) with tympanostomy tubes is:

 
                  
                     Five drops (0.25 mL, 0.75 mg ofloxacin) instilled into the affected ear twice daily for ten days. The solution should be warmed by holding the bottle in the hand for one or two minutes to avoid dizziness which may result from the instillation of a cold solution.
                     The patient should lie with the affected ear upward, and then the drops should be instilled. The tragus should then be pumped 4 times by pushing inward to facilitate penetration of the drops into the middle ear. This position should be maintained for five minutes. Repeat, if necessary, for the opposite ear.
                  
                  
                     Chronic Suppurative Otitis Media with perforated tympanic membranes:The recommended dosage regimen for the treatment of chronic suppurative otitis media with perforated tympanic membranes in patients 12 years and older is:

 
                  
                     Ten drops (0.5 mL, 1.5 mg ofloxacin) instilled into the affected ear twice daily for fourteen days. The solution should be warmed by holding the bottle in the hand for one or two minutes to avoid dizziness which may result from the instillation of a cold solution. The patient should lie with the affected ear upward, before instilling the drops. The tragus should then be pumped 4 times by pushing inward to facilitate penetration into the middle ear. This position should be maintained for five minutes. Repeat, if necessary, for the opposite ear.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Ofloxacin otic solution, 0.3% is supplied in plastic dropper bottles in the following sizes:
                  NDC 24208-410-05 5 mL 
    NDC 24208-410-10 10 mL
adverseReactions_original: Ofloxacin otic solution, 0.3% is contraindicated in patients with a history of hypersensitivity to ofloxacin, to other quinolones, or to any of the components in this medication.
